results.title: A Crowded wilderness
results.creator_credit: Grant Kennedy, Roger Hart and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Spacious, limitless as they may seem, Canada’s National Parks may not be able to keep up with the demands made on their resources without a continuing program of extending the parks system. Wilderness may, in fact, be the greatest heritage this generation of Canadians can leave to future generations. The problems, and the need to act now, are well defined in this film by concerned conservationists.

results.title: A Country practice: the wedding
results.creator_credit: Brendan Maher, Lynn Bayonas and JNP Films
results.brief_description: Television soaps are famous for their elaborate funerals, births and weddings, and long-running Australian favourite “A Country Practice” was no different. This episode features the long awaited wedding of city doctor Simon Bowen to local vet Vicky Dean. Between last minute patient emergencies and an injured horse requiring urgent attention, locals wonder - will Simon and Vicky make it to the church on time?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brendan Maher, Lynn Bayonas and JNP Films

results.title: A Cosmic christmas
results.creator_credit: Clive A Smith, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Learning Corporation of America and Nelvana
results.brief_description: An animated film in which a small town rediscovers the real spirit of Christmas thanks to three alien visitors from outer space and a little boy named Peter. Suitable for lower and middle primary level.

results.title: A Child is born
results.brief_description: Traces the relationship between a young wife and her husband from the time that they decide to have children to the birth and homecoming of their first child. Shows the development of the foetus using live photography and the actual birth of the child, capturing the blend of pain and joy in life’s most miraculous moment. Adapted from the film “Barnet (the child)” produced by Skandia Insurance Company, Stockholm. Narrated by Mary S. Caldesone.

results.title: A Collection of carols
results.creator_credit: William Forest Crouch and New Official Films
results.brief_description: Come all ye faithful; “The First Noel”; “It Came upon a midnight clear”; “Joy to the world”; “Hark! The Herald angels’ sing”; “Silent night”. A gang of morose adolescent boys besiege the doors of a church, overhead, a radioactive space baby illuminates the night sky. Drawings detail the unsavoury habits of certain rural communities as shepherds obscenely fondle their ward and throughout a vigorous stentorian choir sings hymns of praise.

results.title: A Class Divided
results.creator_credit: William Peters and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description: Jane Elliott divided her classroom into blue-eyed and brown-eyed children to teach them the degrading effects of discrimination. “A Class Divided” shows the result of her teaching on the adults who took her class as children in the 1960’s. Her teaching method was so successful that it has been used as a basis for training workshops on racism within the US prison system, and is used by business companies to expose racist attitudes amongst employees and employers. Elliott herself says that the “necessity for this exercise is a crime. But I think this exercise ought to be taught by every teacher.”

results.title: A City is
results.creator_credit: James Carney, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: More than buildings, more than people, a city is a total expression of purpose and aspiration, past and present. This is a multi-image look at the conglomerate city, composed of a whole stream of visual and auditory impressions presented without commentary. Often the screen subdivides - two, three, a dozen images appear at the same time, creating a counterpoint of the turbulence and discord, the harmony and sophistication of the big city.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Carney, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Christmas Special with Luciano Pavarotti
results.brief_description: A glorious concert performed at the spectacular Notre Dame Cathedral, Montreal, Luciano Pavarotti’s Christmas present to music lovers everywhere. Conducted by Franz Paul Decker with “Les Petits Chanteurs” and “Les disciples de Massenmet”. Features “Christmas Medley”, “O Holy Night”, “Pieta Signore”, “Gloria”, “Silent Night”, “Ave Maria”, “Mille Cherubini in Coro”, “Agnus Dei”, “Gesu Bambino”, “Panis Angelicus”, “Oh Come All Ye Faithful”, “O Jesu Christii”, and “Hallelujah Chorus”.

results.title: A Christmas gift
results.creator_credit: Will Vinton, Billy Budd Films and Film Loft Productions
results.brief_description: Clay animated film by Will Vinto capturing the spirit of Christmas, where the happiest Christmas is shared by a young boy and an old lady over a simple candle-lit dinner of cheese, bread and wine. Based on the song entitled ‘Christmas Dinner’ by Paul Stookey of Peter, Paul and Mary.

results.title: A Burlesque on Carmen
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin, Jesse Robbins and Essanay Film Manufacturing Company
results.brief_description: This film was intended by Chaplin to be a two-reel film, but to his annoyance additional material was added after he left Essanay, the Production Company of the film. It is a parody of two contemporary films based on Bizet’s opera, by Cecil B. De Mille (starring Geraldine Ferrar) and Raoul Walsh (starring vamp Theda Bara). Chaplin plays Darn Hosiery (Don Jose), the Corporal of the Guard who is seduced by Carmen (Edna Purviance) so that gypsy smugglers can get their swag through the city gates. His chief rivals for Carmen’s affections are Escamillo, the toreador and a fellow soldier of the guard, Leo White.
